sen.j: 勝持寺（しょうじじ）は、京都市西京区にある天台宗の寺院。
sen.e: Shoji-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Tendai Sect located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shoji-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Tendai Sect located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shoji-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Tendai Sect located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 山号は小塩山。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is Oshioyama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Oshioyama.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Oshioyama.

sen.j: 本尊は薬師如来。
sen.e: The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai.
The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai.
The principal image is Yakushi Nyorai.

sen.j: 花の寺（はなのてら）として知られる。
sen.e: It is known as "Hana no Tera" (lit. Flower Temple).
It is known as "Hana no Tera" (lit. Flower Temple).
It is known as Hana no Tera (lit. Flower Temple).

sen.j: 西国薬師四十九霊場第四十二番札所。
sen.e: It is the 42nd temples on the Saigoku Yakushi 49 Sacred Places pilgrimage.
It is the 42nd temples on the Saigoku Yakushi 49 Sacred Places pilgrimage.
It is the 42nd temples on the Saigoku Yakushi 49 Sacred Places pilgrimage.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 勝持寺は京都の西南郊外の大原野に位置し、大原野神社に隣接する。
sen.e: Shoji-ji Temple is situated in Oharano, a southwestern suburb of Kyoto, adjacent to Oharano-jinja Shrine.
Shoji-ji Temple is situated in Oharano, a southwestern suburb of Kyoto, adjacent to Oharano-jinja Shrine.
Shoji-ji Temple is situated in Oharano, a southwestern suburb of Kyoto, adjacent to Oharano-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 大原野神社は延暦3年（784年）、長岡京遷都時に、奈良の春日神社（現・春日大社、藤原氏の氏神）の分霊を祀ったものである。
sen.e: Oharano-jinja Shrine was founded when the divided deity of Kasuga-jinja Shrine (now Kasuga-jinja Shrine, an ancestral shrine of the Fujiwara clan) in Nara was enshrined during the relocation of the capital to the city of Nagaoka-kyo.

Oharano-jinja Shrine was founded when the divided deity of Kasuga-jinja Shrine (now Kasuga-jinja Shrine, an ancestral shrine of the Fujiwara clan) in Nara was enshrined during the relocation of the capital to the city of Nagaoka-kyo.

Oharano-jinja Shrine was founded in 784 when the divided deity of Kasuga-jinja Shrine (now Kasuga-jinja Shrine, an ancestral shrine of the Fujiwara clan) in Nara was enshrined during the relocation of the capital to the city of Nagaoka-kyo.

sen.j: 勝持寺は古くから桜の名所として知られ、西行ゆかりの寺として知られるが、創建についてはあまり明らかでない。
sen.e: Since ancient times, Shoji-ji Temple has been famous for its cheery blossom as well as its connection to Saigyo but little is known of its founding.
Since ancient times, Shoji-ji Temple has been famous for its cheery blossom as well as its connection to Saigyo but little is known of its founding.
Since ancient times, Shoji-ji Temple has been famous for its cheery blossom as well as its connection to Saigyo but little is known of its founding.

sen.j: 寺伝では白鳳年間（672年～686年）役小角の創建と伝えられる。
sen.e: According to temple legend, it is reputed to have been founded by En no Ozunu between the years 672 and 686.
According to temple legend, it is reputed to have been founded by En no Ozunu between the years 672 and 686.
According to temple legend, it is reputed to have been founded by En no Ozunu between the years 672 and 686.

sen.j: その後延暦10年（791年）最澄が再興して小塩山大原寺と称し、仁寿年間（851 - 854年）千観によって再興されたという。
sen.e: It was later restored by Saicho in 791 and named Oshioyama Daigen-ji Temple before going on to be restored again by Senkan between the years if 851 and 854.
It was later restored by Saicho in 791 and named Oshioyama Daigen-ji Temple before going on to be restored again by Senkan between the years if 851 and 854.
It was later restored by Saicho in 791 and named Oshioyama Daigen-ji Temple before going on to be restored again by Senkan between the years of 851 and 854.

sen.j: 応仁の乱で焼失し、天正年間（1573年～1592年）に再建された。
sen.e: It was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but rebuilt between 1573 and 1592.
It was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but rebuilt between 1573 and 1592.
It was destroyed by fire during the Onin War but rebuilt between 1573 and 1592.

sen.j: 江戸時代には桂昌院の帰依を受けた。
sen.e: It earned the devotion of Keishoin during the Edo period.
It earned the devotion of Keishoin during the Edo period.
It earned the devotion of Keishoin during the Edo period.

sen.j: 木造薬師如来坐像 - 当寺の本尊。

sen.j: 像高85cm。
sen.e: 85cm tall.
85cm tall.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代。
sen.e: Dates from the Kamakura period.
Dates from the Kamakura period.
Dates from the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 左手に薬壺を持ち、右手をその上にかざすような珍しい印相を示す。
sen.e: The left hand holds a gallipot while the right hand is giving a unique hand gesture as if shading the gallipot.
The left hand holds a gallipot while the right hand is giving a unique hand gesture as if shading the gallipot.
The left hand holds a gallipot while the right hand is giving a unique hand gesture as if shading the gallipot.

sen.j: 木造薬師如来坐像 - 像高9.1cmの小像だが、光背には七仏薬師と十二神将像を表す精緻な作である。
sen.e: Wooden seated statue of Yakushi Nyorai: This statue is small at 9.1cm but is delicately crafted with images of the Shichibutsu Yakushi (Seven Healing Buddhas) and Juni Shinsho (Twelve Protective Deities) depicted in the halo.

Wooden seated statue of Yakushi Nyorai: This statue is small at 9.1cm but is delicately crafted with images of the Shichibutsu Yakushi (Seven Healing Buddhas) and Juni Shinsho (Twelve Protective Deities) depicted in the halo.

Wooden seated statue of Yakushi Nyorai: This statue is small at 9.1 cm but is delicately crafted with images of the Shichibutsu Yakushi (Seven Healing Buddhas) and Juni Shinsho (Twelve Protective Deities) depicted in the halo.

sen.j: 平安時代前期。
sen.e: It dates from the first part of the Heian period.
It dates from the first part of the Heian period.
It dates from the first part of the Heian period.

sen.j: 木造金剛力士立像 - 弘安8年（1285年）、法眼慶秀と法橋湛□（1字不明）の作の銘がある。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Kongo Rikishi: Dates from 1275 and carries inscriptions of the names 'Hogen Keish'u and Hokkyo [illegible].
Wooden standing statue of Kongo Rikishi: Dates from 1275 and carries inscriptions of the names 'Hogen Keish'u and Hokkyo [illegible].
